Class CubeFactory

java.lang.Object
  CubeFactory

public class CubeFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Purpose:

Develop the CubeFactory class, which is comprised of two methods. The method formCubes of type int[] instantiates a new array of size |n|+1 and fills it so the ith element contains the value i*i*i. It then returns the array. The second method, sumArray, has a local variable n, which is immediately set to one less the length of the parameter a, which is an integer array. The equation n*n*(n+1)*(n+1)/4 is used to compute the sum of the elements in the array.

Date : Sep 21, 2010

Author:
M. Ingram

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Prints out the array that has been filled by the formCubes method, followed by the sum of the array, which has been computed by the sumArray method.

Parameters:
args -

formCubes

public static int[] formCubes(int n)
Method of type int[] which instantiates the cube array as a new integer array, of length |n|+1. Using a simple for loop, the array is filled with the cubes of each element.

Parameters:
n - number of cubes to compute.
Returns:
the array cubes, which is filled with the cubes of each number from 1 to n.

sumArray

public static int sumArray(int[] a)
Method that computes the sum of the cubes developed by the formCubes method. We use n to represent one less the length of the array. We can then use the equation n*n*(n+1)*(n+1)/4 to calculate the sum.

Parameters:
a - array of cubes to be added together.
Returns:
sum of the array of cubes.
